Home → Help using the service → Using library computers

Using library computers

All of our libraries offer free, unlimited wifi. How to get on to wifi in our libraries.

Computers in our libraries

You can book a computer at all Suffolk libraries and Suffolk record offices. You can book up to 21 days in advance with a maximum of 15 bookings every 21 days.

You can also book a computer online.

Most libraries have computers that are available without a booking.

You can plug a USB stick into any of our computers and print a document.

We offer 3 types of computer for public use in our libraries.

Chromebook laptops

You can sit anywhere you want to in the library by borrowing one of our Chromebooks. These are fast, simple machines, ideal for browsing, checking email, going on Facebook and so on.

To borrow a Chromebook, any overdue fines on your account must be under the £14 limit, and you must have paid for any library items you have lost in the past. If you have been a member of the library for less than three months, you may be asked for additional proof of address.

The length of time you are allowed to borrow a Chromebook for is 1-2 hours, depending on which library you're using. There is a 13p fine for every minute you have the Chromebook after the time limit. You are responsible for any damage caused to the device while it is in your possession, and may be liable to pay up to £180 depending on the extent of the damage.

Chromebase computers

Like the Chromebook laptops, these machines are ideal for browser-based activities.

Windows PCs

These machines feature more software than the Chromebooks and Chromebases, including Microsoft Office, making them the best choice for editing and printing documents such as CVs, letters and essays.

Privacy & cookies

By using our site you agree to our use of cookies. Find out what cookies we use, how they affect you and how you can control them: our cookie policy.

Suffolk Libraries HMRC charity number is XT34476 and our registered company number is IP031542.
